answers.answer: I had metformin 850mg once a day. OB stopped when I was 8 wks pg.

I take  metformin 750 mg a day and prednisone 5 mg a day and prometrium 200mg a day.  Metformin takes care of your sugar so that your body doesn't and it has more energy (for lack of a better word)  To care for your baby.

While TTC I took metformin 1500mg each day until I was 12 weeks pregnant.  I am 24 weeks now and everything is fine.  I find it strange your doc would start you on it at this point (unless maybe he is thinking you have diabetes??).  basically if he thinks your embryo is fine then you shouldn't need metformin at this point and if he thinks the embryo is failing I seriously doubt metformin could actually "save" it.  Most people go on metformin for treatment of pcos prior to being pregnant...it can help regulate your cycles, help you conceive and decrease miscarriage risk.  What metformin actually does is limit the absorption of glucose from your intestine, decrease synthesis of glucose from your liver and helps increase insulin sensitivity.  What these all do is reduce your blood sugar level.  Having high blood sugar is very hard on your organs and that is why it is important for diabetics to constantly monitor their blood sugar.  pcos is kind of like pre-pre-diabetes and therefore metformin can help treat that condition.
I took Metformin (1000mg/day) throughout my pregnancy.  My doctor was adamant that I did not stop it during my pregnancy.
